headline: Nvidia is part of the Dow: A look back on Big Tech in the index
summary: Chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) and paint company Sherwin-Williams (SHW) have joined the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) this Friday, replacing Intel (INTC) and Dow Inc. (DOW). Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre joins the Morning Brief to break down the push for more tech representation in the Dow, which historically lacked many tech stocks until companies like Microsoft (MSFT) and Intel joined during the dot-com bubble. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: A New Era Begins Today for the Iconic Dow Jones Industrial Average
summary: For only the 53rd time in 128 years, the ageless Dow Jones will see its components change.
